org.jerkar.tool
Class JkBuildDependencySupport

java.lang.Object
  org.jerkar.tool.JkBuild
      org.jerkar.tool.JkBuildDependencySupport
Direct Known Subclasses:
JkJavaBuild
public class JkBuildDependencySupport
extends JkBuild

Template build definition class providing support for managing dependencies and multi-projects.

Field Detail

STD_LIB_PATH

protected static final java.lang.String STD_LIB_PATH
Default path for the non managed dependencies. This path is relative to JkBuild.baseDir().

See Also:
Constant Field Values

repo

protected JkBuildDependencySupport.JkOptionRepos repo

version

protected java.lang.String version
Constructor Detail

JkBuildDependencySupport

protected JkBuildDependencySupport()
Method Detail

version

public JkVersion version()
The current version for this project. It has to be understood as the 'release version', as this version will be used to publish artifacts.
It may take format as 1.0-SNAPSHOT, trunk-SNAPSHOT, 1.2.3-rc1, 1.2.3, ... This may be injected using the 'version' option, otherwise it takes the value returned by version() If not, it takes the result from version()

moduleId

public JkModuleId moduleId()
Returns identifier for this project. This identifier is used to name generated artifacts and by dependency manager.

versionedModule

protected final JkVersionedModule versionedModule()
Returns moduleId along its version

downloadRepositories

protected JkRepos downloadRepositories()
Returns the download repositories where to retrieve artifacts. It has only a meaning in case of using managed dependencies.

publishRepositories

protected JkPublishRepos publishRepositories()
Returns the repositories where are published artifacts.

depsFor

public final JkPath depsFor(JkScope... scopes)
Returns the resolved dependencies for the given scope. Depending on the passed options, it may be augmented with extra-libs mentioned in options extraXxxxPath.

dependencies

protected JkDependencies dependencies()

defaultScope

protected JkScope defaultScope()
The scope that will be used when a dependency has been declared without scope.

implicitDependencies

protected JkDependencies implicitDependencies()
Returns the dependencies that does not need to be explicitly declared. For example, it can include all jar file located under build/libs directory.

Normally you don't need to override this method.

dependencyResolver

public final JkDependencyResolver dependencyResolver()

scopeMapping

protected JkScopeMapping scopeMapping()
Returns the scope mapping used by the underlying dependency manager.

publisher

protected JkPublisher publisher()
